item.title: Ancient Embryogenesis and Evolutionary Origins
item.description: Ancient Embryogenesis and Evolutionary Origins “Darwin as an Embryo”. In this case, Neoteny really does recapitulates Phylogeny COURTESY: Stable Diffusion. For this year’s delayed Darwin Day post, I will present some of the latest work on ancient embryos which we have been discussing in the DevoWorm group meetings. While this is by no means a complete review, we will discuss the earliest fossil evidence for eggs, embryos, and nervous systems (in animals, not plants), in addition to the conditions that lead to their emergence.
